item.title: Nuclear Anxiety, That Staple of 1980s Cinema, Is Back
item.description: After the Cold War ended, our terror of nuclear war faded from the screen. Now it’s resurgent — and more fatalistic than ever.

item.title: Can I Tell a Member of My Church That I Recognize Him from a Dating App?
item.description: It would mean a lot to have someone I could relate to.

item.title: The Mushroom Gummies That Claim to Stimulate Your Brain
item.description: Fungal supplements are everywhere, promising happiness, energy, focus, you name it. But what they deliver is something else entirely.

item.title: Are SpaghettiOs Soup?
item.description: A ruling on a “Souper” Bowl party dispute.

item.title: ‘A Terrifying Line Is Being Crossed’: Mayor Jacob Frey on the Turmoil in Minneapolis
item.description: The Minnesota Democrat on the battle between his city and the federal government.

item.title: My Neighbors Are Running an Auto Shop in Their Driveway. What Should I Do?
item.description: I’m afraid that even a code violation could draw attention from ICE.

item.title: Trump’s Immigration Policy Is 100 Years Old
item.description: The White House seems to be mining the Coolidge era for inspiration. But America is not the country it was in 1924.

item.title: Can You Use the Ocean as a Bathroom?
item.description: A ruling on a timeless dispute.

item.title: Michael Pollan Says Humanity Is About to Undergo a Revolutionary Change
item.description: The best-selling author grapples with big questions about A.I., consciousness and the distractions polluting our minds.

item.title: My Cousin Is About to Become Homeless. How Much Should I Give Up for Him?
item.description: I’ve eaten PB&Js for 35 years in an effort to have a retirement where I can do what I want.

item.title: Rev. James Martin on Our Moral Duty in Turbulent Times
item.description: The author and Jesuit priest discusses human dignity, political divides and how he sees the role of the Catholic Church.

item.title: A Group of TikTokers Tried to Detox Their Timelines. The Memes Were Too Strong.
item.description: The attempted “Great Meme Reset” reveals how inescapable the incoherent internet has become.

item.title: ‘We Are Going to Live With Scars’: Yair Golan’s Battle for a Two-State Solution
item.description: To many Israelis, he’s a war hero. To others, he’s a traitor guilty of “blood libel.” Can Yair Golan change politics in Israel?

item.title: ‘All It Is Is Pain’: The Olympian Testing the Limits of Endurance
item.description: Jessie Diggins has become the best-ever American cross-country skier because of what she pushes her body through.
